revised_title: The Relative Roles of Mutation and Selection in Maintaining Genetic Variability
tldr: The author discusses the maintenance of genetic variability in natural populations, emphasizing the roles of mutation and selection. They argue that a large proportion of genetic variability is neutral or nearly neutral at the protein or DNA level. While frequency-dependent selection exists, it is not a significant factor in maintaining genetic variability, except in special cases. The driving force of evolution is mutation rather than selection.
